channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: French Prime Minister resigns after less than a month in office
item.description: Facing criticism from all sides, France's new prime minister Sébastien Lecornu resigned less than 24 hours after naming his government and after less ...

item.title: The medicine Nobel Prize goes to 3 scientists for work on peripheral immune tolerance
item.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were honored for research into how the body helps the immune system avoid attacking your own tissu...

item.title: CBS' next top editor to be Bari Weiss of The Free Press
item.description: CBS' parent company will buy The Free Press and install Bari Weiss, its contrarian founder, as editor in chief of CBS News.

item.title: Civil rights jobs have been cut. Those ex-workers warn of ICE detention violations
item.description: After layoffs, it's unclear how many people are policing civil rights violations inside the Department of Homeland Security, even as the Trump adminis...

item.title: Amid funding cuts and public health battles, NIH issues autism research grants
item.description: Cornell University will receive $5.1 million as the Trump administration seeks to find a source and cure for autism.

item.title: Appeal could extend mandatory prison term for Australia mushroom murderer
item.description: Prosecutors say a woman convicted of murdering family members with toxic mushrooms was given a "manifestly inadequate" sentence, and they want it exte...

item.title: New Zealand pays Samoa millions after naval ship crash
item.description: HMNZS Manawanui started leaking oil into the ocean after it sank in Samoan waters a year ago.

item.title: Watch: Race to reach hikers stranded by Mount Everest blizzard
item.description: Chinese state media reports say around 350 people have been rescued and efforts are under way to reach more than 200 others.

item.title: Australian prosecutors appeal mushroom murderer's 'inadequate' sentence
item.description: Erin Patterson was jailed for a minimum of 33 years for murdering three people with a toxic mushroom meal.

item.title: Rescuers helping hundreds of Mount Everest hikers trapped by heavy snow
item.description: Rescue workers were helping hundreds of hikers trapped by heavy snow at tourist campsites on a slope of Mount Everest in Tibet, Chinese state media sa...

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from sending troops from California to Portland
item.description: The decision late on Sunday comes a day after the same judge barred the deployment of troops from the state of Oregon.

item.title: Feds shoot woman in Chicago after allegedly being rammed, boxed in by cars
item.description: The woman, as well as a man whom authorities say was involved in the chaos, were facing charges Sunday morning.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu resigns after less than a month
item.description: The shock move comes 26 days after his appointment following the collapse of the previous government of François Bayrou.

item.title: Israel-Hamas negotiations spurred by Trump ceasefire plan to start
item.description: Trump wants Israeli and Hamas negotiators to "move fast" in new talks aimed at securing a ceasefire in the Gaza war, spurred by his 20-point plan.

item.title: 10/5: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Americans fed up with how Trump, GOP and Democrats are handling shutdown, poll finds; Second life for California trees burned in wildfires

item.title: Ex-NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez stabbed multiple times in altercation leading to charges against him
Using helicopters and chemical agents, immigration agents become increasingly aggressive in Chicago
Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump administration from sending National Guard troops to Oregon
item.description: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying any National Guard units to Oregon, including the California National Guar...
